result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CASES: 16CF63, 17CF125, 17CF193, 17CF276, 17CF419, 15TR2253, 15TR2255, 15TR2254, 15CF302 Defendant Rick D. Madsen, #489120 in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Rick D. Madsen, #489120 in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KJB- Clerk. 846am 

PSI waived. CT- based upon review of record- in 419 & 125 PHAs have occur.;  in 193 and 276 PHs have not occur. but counsel agrees that Def is pleading to misdemeanors. 

16CF63, 15TR2253, 15TR2255, 15TR2254, 15CF302: all counts are DRI.

17CF125-  G pleas to Ct 1 & Ct 2, Cts 3 & 4- DRI. 

17CF193- G plea to Ct 1, Cts 2 & 3- DRI. 

17CF276- G plea to Ct 4, Cts 1, 2, 3, and 5- DRI. 

17CF419- NC plea to Ct 1, Ct 2- DRI. 

CT accepts pleas, finds G, enters JOC. 

2007, 2009 and 2010 files that were on the calendar are already closed and will not be addressed today. 

Ex #1 O/R. 

SENTENCING: 

17CF125- 
Ct 1: w/h sent, prob 3 yrs- and comply with any AODA and reqs of probation, concur w/17CF419. 1 yr cond time- banked for use by probation, subject to WR but not GT. $250 DNA surcharge & sample. no court costs. costs to be paid through probation while on probation- if not paid while on probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Elig for CIP and SAP

Ct 2: I/S 4yrs- 2 IC 2 ES, consec to 17CF419,  prob 3 yrs- and comply with any AODA and reqs of probation. $250 DNA surcharge & sample. costs to be paid through probation while on probation- if not paid while on probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Elig for CIP and SAP

17CF193- w/h sent, 1 yr prob- and comply with any AODA and reqs of probation, no court costs. $200 DNA surcharge & sample- costs to be paid through probation while on probation- if not paid while on probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment. Elig for CIP and SAP

17CF276- w/h sent, 1 yr prob- and comply with any AODA and reqs of probation, 3 days sent. cred. no court costs. $200 DNA surcharge & sample- costs to be paid through probation while on probation- if not paid while on probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment. No contact with Scottie Kobs.  Elig for CIP and SAP

17CF419-  Ct 1: I/S  4 yrs- 2 IC, 2 ES.  3 yrs prob- and comply with any AODA and reqs of probation. $290.60 fine/cost, DNA sample and $250 surcharge. costs to be paid through probation while on probation- if not paid while on probation, may be reduced to a civil judgment. No contact with Eugene Frederickson. Not elig for CIP or SAP.   Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
